headline: Trump gives Dr. Oz ‘complete and total endorsement’ in wide-open PA Senate race
author: Patrick Reilly
sentences: “Former President Donald Trump’s potential endorsement holds significant weight in the Republican primary: 61% of Republican primary voters say they are more likely to vote for a candidate if he endorses them, while 13% say it makes them less likely to vote for that candidate, and 26% report that it makes no difference,” Kimball wrote in response to the poll results.

)”
Trump said he was giving his “Complete and Total endorsement” to Oz for his stance on abortion, crime, the Second Amendment, border security, the military, education, energy independence and “election fraud,” making him “the one most able to win the General Election” against Democrats, even in cities like Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

They know him, believe him, and trust him.”
Trump had previously announced his endorsement for early frontrunner Sean Parnell in the Pennsylvania race in August after Republican Sen. Patrick Toomey said he would not run for reelection.

Oz, 61, declared he was running for Senate in November in an op-ed published in the Washington Examiner, in which he slammed the government’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic, claiming it caused “heavy suffering.”

Seven candidates will be on the Republican primary ballot on May 17, including the current poll leader David McCormick, a hedge-fund manager who led Oz by 9 points in a Fox News poll published in early March.
A more recent poll from Emerson College conducted between March 26 and 28 found McCormick and Oz in a dead heat, polling at 14 percent apiece with 51 percent of Republican voters undecided.
However, Parnell suspended his campaign after a judge ruled against him in a custody battle amid allegations that he had abused his estranged wife and three children.
Trump’s endorsement could give Oz a much-needed push just a month before the primary, according to Spencer Kimball, Executive Director of Emerson College Polling.
